block.p: Muriel Maignan, a daughter of Camie and Ferauld Maignan of Brentwood, N.Y., was married yesterday to Arden Wilkins, a son of Jessie Wilkins of Washington and the late Wadell Wilkins. Msgr. Russell Dillard performed the ceremony at St. Brigid Church in Westbury, N.Y.

Mrs. Wilkins, 29, is the senior director of marketing at the Women's Consumer Network, an Internet business in Washington with products and services for women. She graduated cum laude from Georgetown University and received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. Her father, who retired as director of the Rome office of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, now works in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, as the executive director of the local office of Caritas, the Roman Catholic social services agency.

Muriel Maignan, a daughter of Camie and Ferauld Maignan of Brentwood, N.Y., was married yesterday to Arden Wilkins, a son of Jessie Wilkins of Washington and the late Wadell Wilkins. Msgr. Russell Dillard performed the ceremony at St. Brigid Church in Westbury, N.Y.

Mrs. Wilkins, 29, is the senior director of marketing at the Women's Consumer Network, an Internet business in Washington with products and services for women. She graduated cum laude from Georgetown University and received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. Her father, who retired as director of the Rome office of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, now works in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, as the executive director of the local office of Caritas, the Roman Catholic social services agency.

Mr. Wilkins, 29, is a therapist at the Physical Therapy Sports Assessment Center in Silver Spring, Md. He graduated cum laude from the University of the District of Columbia and received a master's degree summa cum laude in physical therapy from Thomas Jefferson University.
